intro: Lissochilus schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's lissochilus, is a species of flowering plant in the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in mountainous forests. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
